[b][color=white]Follow or Subscribe to Members[/color][/b]
One can follow a particular member and can choose the notification type through which one can be notified. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6104948]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]QR Login[/color][/b]
Another brand new useful feature to have a quick login on mobile devices. Now users can scan a QR code from their mobile and can log in seamlessly. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6104942]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 481

posts.message:
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4570721][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/animenews-megane.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid to Return in 2021![/color][/b]
The second season for "Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid" has been announced and it will return sometime next year! The anime will be titled, "Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid S." An [url=https://resize.cdn.otakumode.com/resize/1600/u/3c34a2954ef64af994b535989e28d781.jpg]image[/url] teaser was posted of the main characters forming an "S" with their hands. [i][size=x-small][url=https://otakumode.com/news/5f326be3975608d54acb759e/Miss-Kobayashi-s-Dragon-Maid-to-Return-in-2021!]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Variety: AT&T Asks at Least US$1 Billion for Crunchyroll From Multiple Buyers[/color][/b]
Recently, AT&T offered to sell its anime streaming service to Sony for $1.5 billion. However, Sony was appalled with this offer, as they believe the streaming service should not rate themselves that highly. Not just sony, but AT&T has made offers to other companies to sell their Crunchyroll platform to. Why is AT&T trying to sell Crunchyroll? AT&T is trying to sell whatever asset they can to help pay off their $151 billion debt load. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-13/variety-at-t-asks-at-least-usd1-billion-for-crunchyroll-from-multiple-buyers/.162896]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]HIDIVE to Stream My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Climax! Anime's English Dub[/color][/b]
The third season of "My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Climax" will be getting an English dub starting on August 20 and the first four episodes will be uploaded. However, for the time being, it is only known to be available on the streaming service HIDIVE. The dub will be available worldwide except for Asia, Frane, Germany, Monaco, Austria, Belgium, Italy, and Switzerland.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-13/hidive-to-stream-my-teen-romantic-comedy-snafu-climax-anime-english-dub/.162916]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]SUPER HXEROES Anime Delays Episode 8, Airs 'Episode 7.5' Instead Next Week[/color][/b]
The official Twitter account for the time "Super HXEROES" anime Tweeted that the eighth episode scheduled for August 14th will be delayed, and instead, episode 7.5 will air. Usually, when an anime does this, the event is going to be some filler or review of the previous chapters. If you do not want to waste your time, feel free to skip it. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/daily-briefs/2020-08-15/super-hxeroes-anime-delays-episode-8-airs-episode-7.5-instead-next-week/.162973]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]All-New Free! Anime Film's New Teaser Announces 2021 Opening[/color][/b]
The latest anime in the "Free!" series was "Free! ~Road to the World~ Yume" and was released in the summer of 2009. Recently posted on Kyoto Animation's website for the "Free" anime series, they posted a [url=https://youtu.be/FBwLJWcTBaE]video trailer[/url] and an image teasing a new movie in the works that will be in theatres sometime in 2021. Last November, the movie was scheduled to hit theatres in the summer of this year, but with everything going on in the world right now, it was delayed instead. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-15/all-new-free-anime-film-new-teaser-announces-2021-opening/.162975]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Phantasy Star Online 2 Game Expands Release to 33 More Countries Including Europe, India, Oceania[/color][/b]
Not to be confused with the "Phantasy Star Online 2: New Genesis" game that will be releasing in 2021, the website for Phantasy Star Online, has announced that Phantasy Star Online 2 is now available on Steam. Sega revealed that the game would also be available in 33 additional countries for the very first time. Before this announcement, the game was scheduled to only release to 35 countries on August 5. There are too many countries to list, but most North America, South America, Europe, and Asia will be getting this release. If you live in a populated country and have access to Steam, you are most likely to get it. The game is free to play, but there are optional in-game purchases. The game will offer audio in English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Russian, and Japanese.

In short, this game was initially released in Japan in 2012. Then, in April of this year, North America was able to download it but only on Xbox One. After that, the game was later released to the Microsoft Store on May 27. Now, the game is on Steam.

On July 28, the game will activate a cross-play feature, and in addition to that, a cross-progress feature meaning that if you play one day on the PC, your progress will transfer to your Xbox account. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-15/phantasy-star-online-2-game-expands-release-to-33-more-countries-including-europe-india-oceania/.162966]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2774521][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/cryptonews-james.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Tether Moving From Tron to Ethereum[/color][/b]
On August 20, the Chief Technology Officer at Tether (USDT), Paolo Ardoino, told The Block that the stablecoin would be transferring a significant amount of their total supply over to Ethereum. He outlined that "a cryptocurrency exchange is willing to swap part of its Tethers from TRC20 to ERC20." This is known as a chain swap. The token on one blockchain gets sent to the treasury wallet for Tether, by an exchange. After receipt, the same amount on the other blockchain, in this case, Ethereum, is transferred back to the exchange. When the treasury wallet does not contain enough Tether on the blockchain for a chain swap, new USDT gets minted. At the same time, the excess Tether on the old blockchain typically gets burned. It could also be stored for future chain swaps. Before the swap, roughly 60% of the total supply of USDT was on the Ethereum blockchain. This will increase by a further 8%, as 1 billion USDT is moved over from the TRON blockchain.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theblockcrypto.com/amp/linked/75411/tether-1-billion-usdt-tron-ethereum-blockchain] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Driving Licenses on the Blockchain[/color][/b]
In May of 2020, the National Police Agency and the Korea Road Traffic Authority introduced a rather interesting project. The idea was to allow drivers to have their licenses on the blockchain. The Ministry of Science and ICT also embraced the idea, granting its approval. It is the first time that a country-wide digital identification card can be used in South Korea. Over a million drivers have opted to have their licenses on the blockchain, adopting the new scheme. This works out to be more than roughly 3% of the driving population, and that number is estimated to keep on growing. It paves the way for a blockchain-heavy future, with the potential for more countries to use blockchain technology as a secure way of distributing and validating identification documents.[i][size=x-small][url=https://cointelegraph.com/news/one-million-south-koreans-now-have-blockchain-drivers-licenses] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4336296][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/worldnews-simplicity.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Russian opposition leader poisoned[/color][/b]
Alexey Navalny's agent shared that after becoming sick from possible poisoning, he is now in a coma. It is suspected that Alexey had something sipped into his drink at the airport before takeoff because it was the only beverage he'd had for the day. While the allegations are there, it is not yet confirmed. All we know is that Navalny is in a critical condition and is being transported to an undisclosed location to receive proper treatment as at Omsk emergency hospital where he was first taken to, is lacking the needed medical equipment.[i][size=x-small][url=https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/20/europe/russia-navalny-hospitalized-intl-hnk/index.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New rules for dog owners in Germany[/color][/b]
Dog owners in Germany could now be required and legally bound to take out their pets at least twice a week for 1-hour walks, as stated by the proposed new regulations. This, if enforced, would be done with the idea of ensuring owners take proper care of their dogs and do not neglect them or keep them. Other proposals like forbidding keeping them on chains, breeding for specific characteristics and appearance, or looking after too many litters of puppies at a time are also being sought.[i][size=x-small][url=https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/20/europe/german-dog-outside-legal-scli-intl-grm/index.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]What is the situation with COVID-19 right now?[/color][/b]
As the pandemic started and the panic increased, a lot of fake news rolled out, and it kept going on, spreading false information, inducing fear. It was something horrifying at first, but as time passed, many people started to question not the authenticity of COVID-19, but if all this panic and limitations were the right response. The problem is still here, and statistics of infected are rising. Fear has been overcome by a significant percentage of the people around the globe, even though the regulations applied around the pandemic are yet active. We will see where this brings us as only time can tell.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/technews-invisible.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]TikTok has sued the Trump Administration[/color][/b]
TikTok, one of the most fastest growing social networks in the United States, has officially sued the United States federal government, naming US President Donald Trump, Secretary of Commerce Wilbur L. Ross, Jr, and the entire US Department of Commerce as defendants. TikTok claims that the executive order banning them from operating in the United States was not rooted in credible national security concerns, that the  United States federal government ignored TikTok's "extensive efforts to address [their] concerns", and that the potential for TikTok's Chinese parent company, Bytedance, to interfere with TikTok's US operations is non-existent. The federal government has yet to respond to the lawsuit, but the legal precedents that this case could set are significant. [i][size=x-small][url=https://newsroom.tiktok.com/en-us/tiktok-files-lawsuit]>>Source[/url][/size][/i][i][size=x-small][url=https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/7043128/031133742970.pdf] >>Link to full lawsuit[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Russel Kirsch, inventor of the pixel, passes away at 91[/color][/b]
Pixels are everywhere: From the massive screens of New York City's Times Square, to television screens and computer monitors. But prior to 1957, the concept of a pixel was unknown to the world. That was until Russel Kirsch produced an image of his son, Walden, that laid the foundation for digital and computer imaging. He made significant advancements in this field, eventually working for the National Institute of Standards and Technology as an engineer, and could still be heard at lectures as recently as 2011. Russel's work would lead to countless other breakthroughs and marvels of science, including the Apollo moon landings, CT scans, and virtual reality. [i][size=x-small][url=https://petapixel.com/2020/08/13/russell-kirsch-inventor-of-the-pixel-passed-away-this-week/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]The Scots Wikipedia was largely written by an American teenager [/color][/b]
Talk about dedication! A Scottish Redditor by the name of /u/Ultach did some sleuthing, and discovered that most of the Scottish Wikipedia, found at [url=https://sco.wikipedia.org]https://sco.wikipedia.org[/url], was written by someone with little first-hand experience of the subject.
Clocking in at over 20,000 authored articles and more than 200,000 edits, this passionate Wikipedian may have done more harm than good. Though their intentions seem to have been well-meaning, /u/Ultach deduced through the Wikipedian's language and authorship style that they were not a Scot at all, and instead lived in the United States. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.reddit.com/r/Scotland/comments/ig9jia/ive_discovered_that_almost_every_single_article/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
